alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:00AM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow, heavy at times. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches in the lower elevations; 7 to 11 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range and Natrona County. The heaviest snow is expected to occur along and south of a line from Jeffrey City to 20 miles north of Casper. * WHEN...Until 5 AM Tuesday. The steadiest snow is expected this afternoon into Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult after sunset including Interstate 25. The combination of snow and blowing snow could reduce visibility down to a tenth of a mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations
